newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek depo, forwards, bonds hold, ecu/drs hug 311.
newsitem.headline: Greek depo, forwards, bonds hold, ecu/drs hug 311.

text.p: Ecu/drachma was hovering around 311 in early quiet dealing, depos and forex forwards were holding late Friday levels displaying a downward bias and bonds were steady to slightly lower, traders said.
"The drachma is holding its ground against the ecu hugging 311 in early thin trading," a dealer at a private bank said. "The market is very quiet unaffected by the Left's victory in France."
Dealers said they expected last week's pressure on the drachma to dissipate and ecu/drachma as well as mark/drachma to trade in narrow ranges.
Interbank depo rates and forex forwards were stable to easier in calm early dealing, traders said.
"It is very quiet so far," said a dealer at a foreign bank. "Depos and forex forwards hold late Friday levels but it seems to me that they are soft and might recede further during the day."
Bond prices were steady to slightly lower in thin trading and dealers said the French election outcome could benefit EMU outsiders like Greece.

"Unlike core markets, peripheral markets such as Greece might gain from the French election outcome because it could lead to some relaxation of EMU membership rules," said a bond traeer at a private bank. "Italian assets has already gained ground."
The 12-month T-bill carrying a gross rate of 9.60 percent hits the market today. This is 10 basis points lower than the previous issue.
"We will see how the annual T-bill sells today," a trader said. "If it does not sell well, interbnak liquidity will be boosted pushing short-term money rates down."
The mark was quoted at 159.88/93 from Friday's 159.935 fix, the dollar at 273.92/02 drachmas from 271.25 and the ecu at 310.92/02 from 311.000 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following early rates:
